items.sentence: The tiles that fell from the roof broke into pieces.
There are three boys with the name Tom in our class.
I don\'t have enough money to go to Boston with you.
I don\'t know how long Tom is going to stay with us.
Tom invited Mary over to his place to watch a movie.
Tom invited us to have dinner with him and his wife.
Tom had drunk too much coffee so he couldn\'t sleep.
Mary is prettier and makes better grades than Alice.
Tom closed his notebook and put it in his briefcase.
Tom could buy all of those if he really wanted them.
Tom can\'t dress himself and he can\'t feed himself.
Tom probably doesn\'t remember what Mary looks like.
What\'s the cheapest supermarket chain in Australia?
Tom is the best high school catcher I\'ve ever seen.
I expect you to give me an answer by this afternoon.
I don\'t think I\'ve ever heard of anyone named Tom.
I don\'t think I\'ve ever made any serious mistakes.
The soldiers ordered us off the bus and lined us up.
The train was late, but I still got to work on time.
Tom finds it difficult to eat with his new dentures.
Tom got a part-time job to help pay for his tuition.
Tom has gone to the barber shop to get his hair cut.
When I\'m finished with what I\'m doing, I\'ll come.
I wouldn\'t have expected Tom to be able to do that.
Tom wished he hadn\'t asked Mary to stop doing that.
Tom could sense that Mary was trying to impress him.
Tom said he wasn\'t going to make any announcements.
Tom said he wasn\'t sure what Mary wanted him to do.
Tom said he wouldn\'t help, but Mary said she would.
I thought you\'d been killed. I\'m glad I was wrong.
I knew all along that Tom wasn\'t telling the truth.
I know you didn\'t really want to come on this trip.
Tom said that he\'d do just about anything for Mary.
I thought you said you wanted me to do that for you.
I was afraid I might not be able to do it correctly.
I was born in Boston, but was brought up in Chicago.
I didn\'t even know that you used to live in Boston.
Tom, if there\'s a problem, I want to hear about it.
Tom wanted to find out more about Mary\'s childhood.
Tom wanted to know the reason Mary didn\'t like him.
Tom told me that he had not gone shopping with Mary.
Tom told me that he thought Mary could speak French.
Tom told me that he thought he was losing his sight.
Tom told me that you probably know where Mary lives.
You\'ve got to tell Tom he needs to be here at 2:30.
A great man will be remembered for his achievements.
Is it true that Tom lived in Boston for three years?
Tom said that he isn\'t planning on buying anything.
You know I can\'t give out that kind of information.
We\'re eating now. Could you please call back later?
